Since my last review, the adding new tags problem has been completely fixed, as has the speed issue. The loading of each tab and your data now falls within the acceptable time range. The bookshelves still aren't as visual as Shelfari's were, but the update is definitely a step in that direction. The app somehow feels a lot crisper and neater than it ever did before. I'm also encouraged by the fact that they say they're working on more new features as well. I'd still like to see integrations with other apps (Kindle, iBooks, Comixology, Bookout, etc.) but I'm pleased for now with the updates they've made, especially the speed issue, which makes a huge difference in usability. Keep up the great work!

I only gave it 3 stars to attract attention of the app developers. I love this app! I‚Äôm not sure if the app people read this, but I have one suggestion to make this app better. I was just reading the Goodreads email newsletter, and I clicked to add the book to my wishlist, but it doesn‚Äôt directly take me to my app. It directed me to re-login, so I gave up and closed the email. Since other apps have that option to ‚Äúopen in app,‚Äù that would make the experience better.

I love that I can keep up with books I see in passing that I want to read by putting them on my want to read shelve. 
 The reviews really help me out when I‚Äôm choosing my next read. 
 No complaints

I have watched Penn as a side character for several books now. He‚Äôs always been one of those guys that I roll my eyes at and move along. I did not expect to love his book as much as I did! I found Penn to be honest and worthy of his own book. The growth between both Avery and Penn was lovely. Watch out for the slow burn!! After reading the first chapter, you might wonder how on Earth a slow burn I possible, but Locke is pretty much a genius. Happy reading

If you‚Äôre like me, you always check the reviews of an app before downloading, just to make sure it‚Äôs something you want. I absolutely love Goodreads and I think all book lovers will love it too. So far there haven‚Äôt been any blips or problems with the app, in fact usually I find pleasant surprises. Like the fact that even the books I read in foreign languages are here! If you‚Äôre a bookworm, then this will help you track the books you read and help you find new ones. If you‚Äôre ever interested in finding an app to actually read books on, then Libby or Wattpad are also wonderful apps.

Before I waste my time on a book I read the reviews here and base my opinion (with salt) on them - I enjoy that I can see others I trust and what they‚Äôve read with a review to see what‚Äôs out there.
I read a lot and this app really helps me keep track of the reading list. I love writing a brief review afterwards so I can look back at my initial impressions later on. Very helpful.
Helps me keep my love for books alive by challenging myself and serves as a place to discover new books through friends recommendations or overall ratings

I absolutely LOVE the new update/interface. I love how you can pick on the individual grouped star ratings and read all the 1 star reviews or the 5 stars reviews together! I love when you look at a book it gives you other recommendations that are similar to that book. Great work guys!! Keep it up! üòä‚úåüèºÔ∏è
 UPDATE: Come on guys we should be able to do 1/2 stars by now. Some books are worth 3.5 but not quite 4 and some are worth 4.5 but not quite 5. This should be an easy addition to an otherwise awesome app.

What a wonderful story two men who have so many issues and questions about their lives come together to make a beautiful love story full of low angst great interactions with family,although some are not so nice, and sex scenes are glorious look forward for more fun

***Update March 2021***
 I have a notification badge for a request, but no pending requests. Update did not fix my notification bugs. 
 
 I‚Äôm also still wishing for a ‚Äúreturn key‚Äù on keyboard while typing captions in the app. 
 
 Being able to comment directly to others in this app would be great. I know you can do it from the web/desk version, but I never use that. 
 
 We really need the ability to do ‚Äúhalf stars‚Äù. 
 
 **Update to review 2019**
 Would love to be able to "reply" to specific users in comment section of reviews on the iPhone app. Still LOVE this app though! üòâ
 *******************
 
 I love this app! This is my favorite go to app for all things books. Any book you can think of is in this app. I have never...I mean NEVER looked up a book and didn't find it here. Reading reviews and recommendations from real readers is great. It's my go to place to put books in order if they are part of a series. Can't say enough great things about this app. A must have! üòÄüëçüëçüìöüìñ

I love Goodreads for helping me keep up and share what I‚Äôm reading. However, this app makes that far more difficult than the desktop site. The app never shares my progress on Facebook when I select the option for it to do so. Also, I wish the app let access and add quotes from books, but sadly it does not.
It appears that there isn‚Äôt a way to put books in alphabetical order or date. Should also be able to do a sort by author.

Great storyline and characters. I love how the characters are developed throughout the story, so I didn‚Äôt get bored with them. At times, I wondered what was going to happen next. I certainly wasn‚Äôt disappointed! Thank you for a fun summer read.
 
 I received a free copy of this book via Booksprout and am voluntarily leaving a review.

It seems like the UX for this app hasn‚Äôt been updated in years. The search functionality is sub-par, the shelving system isn‚Äôt intuitive (for example, if I pause a book and intend to pick it back up later, I‚Äôm forced to put it back on the Want to Read shelf), finding reviewers to follow is impossible, and getting meaningful book recommendations from my network is non-existent. The user base for this app is massive; please put some work into making meaningful, evolutionary updates!

Kevin Anderson and Doug Beason wrote Trinity Paradox, which is one of the best sci fi books I ever read. The Ill Wind book is a big disappointment. The theme is good: and oil tanker breaks apart and designer microbes are used to try to cope with the spill. It all goes wrong. They say that good editors can ‚Äúremove all those parts that readers skip over‚Äù. This book desperately needed such an editor. The last 150 pages of this 550 page book were more engaging and brought my rating up to 3*.

This app is a blessing and a curse, simply because my ‚Äúwant to read‚Äù list keeps getting longer. I love seeing what my friends are reading, and being able to read the book reviews and follow authors. Great app.

This new version makes it even easier to rate my current read faster!, I also love this app because it allows me to keep up with what books I still want to read and what books I have read and how I rated them.

I love Goodreads but the app is extremely limited compared to the desktop version. Things that would help improve would be the ability to compare friends, respond/reply to others comments so their thread shows up, settings section expanded and group interaction to match the desktop with ability to reply to certain comments and add pics of books.

I absolutely love this app and love that it keeps me motivated! My only wish (the reason for four versus five stars) is that I could easily share updates on Instagram! The only options are for Facebook, Twitter, and Pinterest. At the moment I just share screenshots but would love to be able to share updates of my reading goal progress on my insta stories directly from the app!

I love the app but sometimes it drives me crazy. I make mistakes not because I didn‚Äôt understand it but because it‚Äôs not EXACTLY how it was supposed to be written. This is annoying and it makes me want to stop using the app. I don‚Äôt want to waste my time and lose a whole lesson over something ridiculous. Please, just fix this. It‚Äôs annoying!!!!!!! üò°

I‚Äôve been using Duolingo for a few months and it has really improved my Spanish!! There are so many great features, even without the plus version. One suggestion that I think could make the app even better is if you add in listening comprehension stories like you already have for reading comprehension. I think having both could make for an even better learning experience. This app is great and I would definitely recommend it!!

Duolingo was pretty good before as a learning platform for language outside the classroom or through exposure. Now, with the addition of audio lessons and short stories, it is THE BEST out there. It helps you listen and understand and practice your language to proficiency!

I love the app but I would like some new languages like Tagalog (Philippines language) or finding a way to teach sign language. Tagalog would be really helpful for me because that is my grandmother‚Äôs native language and I would love to be able to speak to her with it. And sign language over all is just really helpful for deaf people and handy.

This app has been a part of my daily routine for more than three months. I feel like I am successfully improving my French (I haven‚Äôt taken courses in over a decade). I appreciate the learning approach. I feel confident, and I genuinely like learning through this app.

I love the app as far as learning vocabulary, but it doesn‚Äôt actually help teach properly. It will just tell you you are wrong without telling you WHY you are wrong. In other words you don‚Äôt get to learn the actual rules of grammar for that language. You just memorize the right answers and hope eventually you figure out a pattern. Again I love this app for learning vocabulary, but I very frequently have to leave the app to go google why I was wrong on something because it doesn‚Äôt tell you. You can‚Äôt FULLY learn a language just memorizing answers. You need to learn all of it. Grammar rules and everything.

I bought Rosetta Stone a few years ago for German, and it‚Äôs great, but it‚Äôs difficult to get a refresher for minor part of German and Duolingo does just that! Each part of the language‚Äôs course it clearly categorizes which aspect you will be learning. You can easily play a quick game for a refresher and I love it. Rosetta Stone never has the English translations, only photos and scenarios of words to be used, but Duolingo simply explains the spelling variations and what to capitalize. I love it! Thank you Duolingo! Plus, it‚Äôs FREE!!! Can‚Äôt go wrong.

I see some videos they say Duolingo kill you mother or father or he pick a picture of Duolingo and your mother or father and I download this but when I go I scared and delete my cute Duolingo I sorry but I can‚Äôt play this game I am a 9 years old girl but I get the 5 stars good luck

This app is wonderful! If you are looking for an app that will teach you a different language in a simple and fun way, then you should DEFINITELY get this. I only have on suggestion: it would be nice if you could look up words in a different language if you really wanted to learn a certain word. Then it would be a perfect app

I have done over 2 years of lessons on Duolingo. The latest version has numerous errors: exercises are marked as incorrect if you provide a translation in either the masculine or feminine form when both should be correct, adding the pronoun to the translation also is incorrectly marked as wrong, an answer that was previously marked as incorrect is later given as a correct alternative. The same exact exercise is given in sequence four out of five times. Please do a better job of proofing exercises!

This used to be my favorite app for learning languages. I would have (and did) recommend it to ANYONE who wanted to pick up another language. But now, they're doing "Duolingo Plus". And suddenly you can run out of hearts during lessons and have to either use gems to refill them or get the Plus subscription. This is RIDICULOUS. Probably going to stop using this unless they return it to what it was. This used to be a great place to learn, and now it's just become money hungry like every other learning app. Stay true to your original values or just don't make apps at all.

There is a sound delay, so it skips the first one or two syllables. So when i try to practice not looking at the words and just practice listening, it is inaccurate.
 
 Also, I wish the sound button to replay the "translate this sentence" audio was bigger

This app is so wonderful I really enjoyed being able to learn Spanish because it‚Äôs what it‚Äôs going to be my second language and it‚Äôs really helpful and it gives you challenges so I really enjoy this app and I can learn Spanish on my phone or tablet or anything and I feel like this is so useful to people who like can‚Äôt afford to like maybe like learn this language in like an clash so I really enjoy the step and I hope that other people do too

As a person using voice over, this is one of the better language apps that I have used. The website is also great and with a few fixes, both would be more than outstanding. on the app side of things, sometimes, I try to use the record Ing feature, and the record icon doesn‚Äôt always respond immediately. Also, I‚Äôve had a little trouble with The voices speaking when I push on the speaker icon to listen for pronunciations. The last thing I want to mention is that sometimes, I have trouble beginning new lessons because double tapping on the skill doesn‚Äôt always respond immediately with the start button. On a good note, all the voices are appealing and speak clear pronunciations. On the website side of things, I have to have cited help to switch courses since the drop-down menu is in accessible, and my computer is having some difficulty reading alphabets other than English. Other than these glitches, everything works fine. Thank you for your time, and I look forward to hearing from you.

Overall, I‚Äôm very happy with Duolingo ‚Äî based on the Italian lessons. It‚Äôs easy to use, intuitive, fun, and you actually learn! There are a few features that must be incorporated to make this a robust app:
 - a dictionary so you can look up words, OR a catalog of all the words you‚Äôve learned so far
 - a consolidated list of grammar rules; they‚Äôre within each lesson, which is fine, but there should be a library somewhere of things learned ‚Äúso far‚Äù
 - a way to add comments to thread discussions on phone. I can only read and upvote/downvote
 - a way to download tips sheets, ideally in a flash card format
 - most importantly, a way to ask clarifying questions. If there was a way to ask 3 questions a month as part of the subscription it would go a long way.
 
 Thanks and keep it up! I am an idea jar if you need more!

Good in theory but the app never actually teaches you grammar rules, the alphabet itself, or explain why one word can have two spellings. Good for spanish or other roman letters but not for anything in any other script. For example, they expect you to jump into hebrew with no vowels and make you assume what letters make each sound. For someone beginning to learn, the vowel symbols are very important. As well as learning each individual letter. And you get neither.

It would be nice if we can slow down the bot talking for all speaking parts in the settings. Like a little bar that goes from slow to fast. Sometimes they say it too fast and I can‚Äôt understand the pronunciation so it would be nice if y‚Äôall could add that

I just started using this a few days ago and I can‚Äôt believe how much easier it is to learn this way. Using pictures, seeing the words, hearing the words, typing the words and speaking the words, makes it so much easier to retain the information. I wish they did this when I was in school! Once I master the language I‚Äôm working on now, I‚Äôll for sure go on to learn another language!

If you don‚Äôt care about reading Japanese characters then this app is not for you. At first I only wanted to speak Japanese so I deleted the app. But I‚Äôve come to realize I need to read as well as speak Japanese as it will enhance my overall learning experience. That being said I redownloaded the app and now I can read hiragana (slowly) and am working on katakana. I was able to learn hiragana in only a few days versus over a couple of months and not being able to remember all the characters by using another paid course. I now use both systems and feel confident in my progress.

For the new year i had a resolution to learn something new this year and decided i wanted it to be a language. After looking over reviews on all of the popular language apps i chose to go with Duolingo. This app far exceeded my expectations. The way the sections are broken down and short lessons so you can accomplish as much or little that you want to do in a day makes it easy to want to pick up. Definitely recommend

So I was looking they the reviews and saw some people complaining about the ‚Äúalgorithm‚Äù saying it favors new players and peers with small sums of coins. These comments are laughable! I‚Äôve played many of the other spades games available for mobile devices, and this one is FAR SUPERIOR than any other app. Keep up the good work!

Usually once the opponent uses all of their powers, they‚Äôre basically defenseless. Just fight through it until then, keep the score as balanced as possible. You‚Äôll realize that skill (without powers) is almost absent up to level 20.

I tucked it down 1 star because of the connection problems. When I am not having to wait for the other player to reconnect or wait forever to get into a match it plays great! Also I would have to complain about after most game it would freeze on the "the final whistle" screen and I would have to force close and reopen it. It's just annoying, I want to play another game fast because one match is only 90s. And it would be great to have more energy for the characters. I'm still in the early stages of the game so maybe the longer I play the characters will have longer energy but 5 games per character is not enough; I'd love to spend more than 10 minutes playing. Other than those couple complains, this game is really fun and competitive haha.

Goodreads is long overdue for an update. This app is old, hard to use, and horrible to look at. Books are inspiring, and the premier book app should be as well. There are so many basic features that should be here  that just are not. I am highly disappointed that Goodreads is not keeping up with the technology innovations we have seen in the last decade.

This is a good app, fairly user friendly, fun, and recently received some great updates that really enhanced it. 

I can't find a way to prevent "trending" books or information about random people's reading occurances from showing up in my feed, which makes the whole feed annoying and useless to me.

I love Goodreads, but unfortunately I have to log in through Safari rather than using the app.  I am part of a group and there are a couple of things that really bug me.  First, when people mark <spoilers> in their review, I can‚Äôt read them in the app.  If I‚Äôve read the book I want to read their entire review including spoilers, but I can‚Äôt from the app.  Second if I can‚Äôt respond to someone‚Äôs review or group comments.  On Safari I can respond but not on the app.  There are other differences but these are the two that bug me the most.  Before I became part of a group I would have given five stars, which is why I give four now.  Still love the app but wish I could respond the way I want to my group reads.

I really this app, the only thing that wish they could have is in the section of ‚Äúto read‚Äù they would have an option has ‚Äúalready own it‚Äù or something in that nature because I had a book in my ‚Äúto read‚Äù section that I already have but I bought it again so I had 2 copies. Otherwise not really any complaint, I like to keep track of the book I‚Äôve already read.
I Iove being able to have a reading goal, see what my friends are reading, keep track of what I‚Äôve read and want to read. The one thing I wish is that I could track my total pages read.

I really love goodreads! I love the browsing and seeing what friends are reading! I really enjoy adding books to my shelf to read! My favorite is logging my progress within a book!  The only thing I wish goodreads would consider is an update!! It‚Äôs not visually appealing and sometimes not as easy to navigate as it should be. I don‚Äôt much care for the color scheme and wish we had other options. Kindle came out with a new interface and I love the way it looks plus links to goodreads. Might have to switch over to using that app more.

I used to love Goodreads. I use it daily and still like it a lot, but I wish Goodreads would make some improvements and take users comments under serious consideration. Some things that need to be improved to make it a great app:
-incorporate all features into mobile app (specifically: ability to flag other users, report reviews to reduce abuse)
-prevent users from being able to have porn links in their profiles
-add security features to prevents profile hijackings (I have seen an inundation of accounts that appear legitimate but with no recent activity that start mass liking and have porn links in account and sometimes fake pictures of ‚Äúladies‚Äù presumably from said porn links

I use this app all the time. Not only to track my reading, but as a quick reference to check books I‚Äôm interested in reading. I love that it keeps all the books I‚Äôd like to read, which helps when heading to the bookstore.

I really love the idea behind goodreads. A platform where book lovers can connect, keep track of books they‚Äôve read/are currently reading/want to read, follow their friends, join groups, write reviews, etc. Overall, I love goodreads. 

However, I would like to see some new features and improved user experience in the app. You can like and comment on your friends‚Äô updates, but you cannot ‚Äúreply‚Äù or tag people. This can only be done via computer. I‚Äôd love to be able to tag my friends in reviews and other updates, as well as directly reply to comments on my updates.

I absolutely love being able to track my reading throughout the year without having to remember all the books. The addition of the scanning option is great. I use to use the old app and the upgrades are so much better than I remembered. Only wish there was a distinction between physical books and audiobooks.

I like the app a lot. I like the fact that I can see what my friends are reading and get a perspective on a book that they loved. It also helps me find something that is worth reading.. but my problem is that I‚Äôm only limited to the friends that has been registered on Good Reads. 

Granted for the fact that I can invite friends but I believe this app would be better if we could follow anyone regardless of favorite author, friends and family. There are some celebrities, musicians, and also Sober bloggers that I admire and would love to see what they are reading. I think this app can be something popular if they opened it up to more celebrities or inspirational speakers. 

I love my friends but I want to know what Laura Mckowen, Talib Kweli, Jimmy Fallon, and more are reading. I want to see what they find as good reads for them. I also think this would expose people to more authors and help them gain more revenue for their books. So that way authors can write more books!

I use this app to track my reading, list books I want to read and get ideas from fellow readers. I can rate books, create my own genres and write reviews. I often refer to this list when making recommendations to feiends.

I love Goodreads! HOWEVER, I wish the app developers would leave well enough alone before they ruin it. Some of the recent changes are just plain annoying and there is no option to opt out of some of these functions. For example, I will start a book and after a chapter or two and may decide to return the book to the ‚Äúto be read‚Äù shelf. Goodreads will list this book as a ‚Äúre-read‚Äù when I return to the book at a later date in the progress column.  I don‚Äôt care for the ‚Äúprogress‚Äù column or the ‚Äúre-read‚Äù  at all and wish I could opt out of them. I realize advertising is a source of revenue for the site but I wish Goodreads would offer a premium option so subscribers like myself who are annoyed by the excessive pop up ads can pay to be rid of them.

I love that I can easily add my books and update reading progress on my phone, but I really wish that the reading challenge on the phone said whether you were on track or not like it does on the desktop version. I tried to go to the website on my phone and it just keeps looping me back to the app, so there‚Äôs no way to know if I‚Äôm ahead or behind without doing the math on my own, which I usually don‚Äôt have time to do when I go to check.

I am having so much fun with this app. I love seeing other people‚Äôs finished books and want to read section. I‚Äôve always used goodreads to measure the value of my next read. Now, contributing to it makes me part of the conversation and community. Which is much needed right now.

I often go to goodreads after reading or listening to a book for a complete summary. But although I search tell all or no need for spoiler alerts they do not always explain all the details I am looking for, they are more promotional as though just in our aging you to read it. I‚Äôm looking for cliff notes- especially for more complicated books that don‚Äôt fully explain all the details such as Ruth Wares‚ÄôThe Turn  of the Key.

I love the concept of this and all of the potential features. But I say ‚Äòpotential‚Äô because half the time half the features don‚Äôt work. The app is always very slow, and often doesn‚Äôt load and gives error messages as you navigate through. I‚Äôm not a coder, I don‚Äôt understand the workings-on of the ones and zeroes under the hood, but someone needs to fix it. Thank you.

I really enjoy using Goodreads to keep track of past, present, and future reads. It‚Äôs easy to use and I really don‚Äôt have many complaints. However it‚Äôs unfortunate I can‚Äôt ‚Äúlike‚Äù or ‚Äúreply‚Äù to comments from others on my activities and reviews (at least on the iOS app?).

This book was beautifully written.  I loved reading it and learning more about Caroline and Mina. The storyline was interesting and the twists and turns kept you coming back for more. I couldn't put it down and read it in one afternoon. I would definitely recommend this book to anyone who loves to read and likes to follow the action. Wonderful read and I am very happy to recommend this book to anyone and to write a review for this author. These books in this series are all written so good and I look forward to reading more in the future. Fantastic!!!!

While this is a great way to track one‚Äôs reading history, I find the app to have some very unusual behaviors. The one that is most difficult to deal with should be the most simple.  When I add a book the app wants to pick the current day as the day I started reading it. Yes, I can go into ‚Äúedit‚Äú and pick my start date of choice. But when I go back into the app later, it insists on reporting that I started the book on the current day. A version of this problem has existed in the app, and on the webpage, ever since I started using this years ago. I do enjoy cataloging my books with Goodreads, and I hope that the functionality can improve.

What happened to the conversation bots? They were the only things I really liked about about this app. They were very helpful with practicing speaking in the other language without having to talk to a real person or give out any personal information. I might just be blind or something. If I am just not seeing them then can someone please let me know where they are?
I really don‚Äôt like that this app doesn‚Äôt properly teach conjugations and then it expects people to know them.

My daily Spanish study regimen one 30-minute Pimsleur audio lesson plus several Duolingo lessons. I‚Äôve been doing this for about 3 months. I also listen to a lot of music in Spanish and have a good friend with whom I speak Spanish. I‚Äôm amazed that I am already able to have complex conversations with Spanish speakers, and how natural it‚Äôs beginning to feel. Duolingo is the perfect companion to Pimsleur, which helps greatly with basic speech and listening comprehension, but teaches limited vocabulary. Duolingo broadens my vocabulary to enable me to form more creative sentences. I like that Duolingo‚Äôs lessons are divided by topic areas (travel, nature, activities, etcetera). I am about halfway through the Duolingo tree and halfway through my Pimsleur lessons. There is a lot of overlap of the material in the two courses, which helps with reinforcement. Once I complete Duolingo and Pimsleur, I feel that with an extended period of immersion, I will reach fluency. Duolingo has been a major part of making this dream of mine a reality. It‚Äôs amazing that such a quality tool exists for free. I will become a plus member again (when it fits my budget) to show my support.

I love this app. It‚Äôs helping me learn French. I tutor a student via the internet in my language, English. I think it would be helpful if I could make personalized lessons for him. Another feature  that I would really like to see added is a feature that when you chat with other people, you can hear someone else‚Äôs voice to learn how to pronounce words in a specific language correctly. That would be a great tool to use considering many people are auditory learners.

I downloaded this app and decided to delete it because of all the advertisements.  Now I am being bombarded with emails from advertisers who received my contact information.  It‚Äôs a full time job now unsubscribing from all of these sites.    For only putting an app on my phone for less than 30 minutes is causing a significant impact to my everyday life. This is absolutely ludicrous!

BTW, I have not installed any other app so I am 100% confident that this app is the reason for all this email activity.  Stop this madness!

I have been using the free app for 3 years now.  It is easy to use and understand.  I play on my phone and on my iPad.  It has been updated and keeps challenging you to perfect the language. Learning a language is not easy and can be frustrating, but Duolingo will prepare you.  Because I have the free version, I lose lives on my iPad but not on my phone.  I don't like it when I lose all my lives and cannot play again for 24 hours.  This keeps me from working on the difficult lessons.  I still love this app.  I use many different sources to learn Ukrainian and this is my favorite.  –î—è–∫—É—é Duolingo! –õ—é–±–ª—é —Ü–µ!!!!!

I have tried several language programs throughout the years and always lose interest in them. Not only is the method of teaching fantastic (learn by doing) but the implementation and user interface is great also.  I love how you can wager points to make more points and how you can work your way up the leaderboard. It‚Äôs simply a great way to learn a language and it‚Äôs both engaging and fun.

I have enjoyed Duolingo for learning languages. Just don‚Äôt put too much stock in their leaderboards and too much effort into competing because you can‚Äôt compete with ‚Äúsomeone‚Äù who picks up hundreds of points in a few minutes. So I‚Äôm officially done with that. You‚Äôd think a mature app would have a solution for that but I‚Äôm sure they want to claim these are all human users. It reeled me in and then turned me off.

I tried many apps to learn the language I want. All of them wanted me to buy more time or more courses, so I deleted all of them. Duolingo doesn‚Äôt ask me to buy any courses or anything like. It only asks me if I want to buy ad free. I would honestly recommend this app to everyone. It‚Äôs such a great app!
I wish you take a language off the board on the iPhone without having to go to the website to take a language off, that you may have added by accident. :( I enjoy Duolingo very much!!

I‚Äôm distracted with so many things nowadays, but Duolingo manages to keep me interested. The gaming and point system gives me a feeling of progress and satisfaction. I‚Äôm slowly learning polish before I travel to Poland later this year. My polish girlfriend is impressed with my progress!

I come in and press the beginner learner, and in there! I learn Spanish and move forward the more I work. It‚Äôs amazing! The only downside is the books. Let me pay a one-off fee to get rid of these horrible ads. They‚Äôre not as aggressive as they could be, but they‚Äôre still pretty awful. They‚Äôre annoying to the point where I almost don‚Äôt want to use the app. Seriously, I have $20 that I‚Äôll happy put toward the cause for a one-time lifetime removal of ads. As it is, I will never click on any of the ads that show up. Ever. And I don‚Äôt need or want to decorate the owl mascot or pay for virtual money. I will not be paying for premium. Just get rid of these lame ads. 

In addition, not being able to use the app when not connected to the internet is annoying. I know I use the app way less often than I used to because the ads are terrible and my wireless connection can be spotty when I‚Äôm traveling. 

I can‚Äôt even say much about the content of Duolingo because the ads show up every three minutes or so and distract from the lessons. What‚Äôs the point of saying it‚Äôs a free service when you‚Äôre bombarded with ads or prompts to upgrade. I think I‚Äôm resisting the existing premium subscription on principle at this point. I‚Äôm not about to reward a company that harasses customers into paying $10 per month not to be constantly annoyed by ads. üòï

I think that Duolingo is absolutely amazing, but I have one concern. I believe that there should be bots on all the languages instead of just having them on the select few. Thank you!

This is a great app, I like it better than other similar apps. My only problem is that the don‚Äôt introduce new words before they throw them at you. This causes you to loose hearts and have to wait until you rebuild before finishing your lessen. If the app writers would introduce the new words gently then throw them into a sentence to decipher it would be a five star app.

I never thought I would learn as much as I have from a free app. My only complaints are that it is not forgiving of typos sometimes. Obviously autocorrect on iPhone is a pain sometimes, so DuoLingo should understand. It also lacks explaining for grammatical rules. Great tool for vocabulary and learning basic phrases.

My complaints are the pressure to maintain a streak or hold your place in a certain league. I find on days when I don‚Äôt feel like practicing, or days when I‚Äôm too busy, I just go on and rush through a lesson to maintain my streak. I don‚Äôt learn anything that way. I can see how that would be motivating for some people, but it‚Äôs turned it into a chore for me.

Thank you for making the program more traveler friendly.  The news categories are much more useful for the language learner who is planning to use the news language while traveling.  
Thank for a great language learning program. And, especially thank you for making it available for free.

The latest update ruins a good thing. The gem and heart system seems obviously built more for Duolingo‚Äôs bottom line than helping their users learn. Overall, the heart system is very frustrating and there are way too many paths designed to have you looking at ads instead of learning. If your serious about learning the only option is to pay to remove hearts and ads, but what about the people around the world who cannot afford it. There has to be a better way Duolingo. Shame.

‚ÄúThe men write in sugar‚Äù and ‚Äúthe cats eat bread‚Äù probably aren‚Äôt the most useful sentences to learn in Italian. I need repetition to learn but I wish this would move a little faster.
